Main.JPN: とてもやさしい人なの

Main.TextJPN: 入院患者に電話が取り次がれる時間は決まっている。
Main.TextENG: Patients admitted to the hospital can only accept calls at fixed times.

Main.TextJPN: …だから、今日はもうあの人からの電話は来ない。
Main.TextENG: ...That's why she wouldn't be receiving a call from him today.

Main.TextJPN: 昨日、寂しがり屋だとからかったから、ひょっとすると電話をかけるかかけまいか、さんざん迷った末に我慢したのかもしれない。
Main.TextENG: Yesterday, she had teased him that he got lonely easily, so he might have struggled with the idea of calling her sooner.

Main.TextJPN: 忙しくて電話できなかったと言うより、そっちの方がはるかに説得力のある想像だった。
Main.TextENG: That was much easier to imagine, rather than that he might just be too busy to call.

Main.TextJPN: …あの人はそういう人だから。@k雪絵はそう呟き、ひとり笑った。
Main.TextENG: ...Because he's just that type of person.@k Yukie, whispering that, smiled to herself.

Main.TextJPN: 面会時間の終わりを告げる院内放送と音楽が流れ始める。
Main.TextENG: The announcement that visiting hours were over played over the hospital intercom along with some music.

Main.TextJPN: 見知った顔の、同室の患者を見舞う家族たちとの挨拶。@k母の退院を心待ちにしているのだろう、小さな子の笑顔が眩しい。
Main.TextENG: She exchanged pleasantries with the family of the patient that was staying in the same room as her.@k Probably eager for his mother to be discharged, their small child was wearing a beaming smile.

Main.TextJPN: その子の母親は、私の隣のベッドで、その子の弟、もしくは妹になる子を身篭っていた。
Main.TextENG: That child's mother was pregnant in the bed next to mine with what may be their new brother or sister.

Main.TextJPN: 新しい兄弟に寄せる期待や不安、夢に、その子の想像ははちきれんばかりになっているのだろう。
Main.TextENG: They were probably ready to burst with the expectations, dreams, and worries of having a new sibling.

Main.TextJPN: 家族が増えていく喜び。
Main.TextENG: The joys of a growing family.

Main.TextJPN: ………そんな温かな気持ちに満たされながら、私はだいぶ大きくなった自分のお腹を撫でた。
Main.TextENG: ...Bathing in those warm feelings, I stroked my own belly, which had grown quite large.

Main.TextJPN: 子どもを何人もうけるか、あの人と話したことはある。
Main.TextENG: I had talked with him about how many children we wanted to have.

Main.TextJPN: ３人もいたら、きっと賑やかだろうねと、話したことはある。
Main.TextENG: We talked about how if we had three, it would certainly be lively.

Main.TextJPN: …でも、目を背けられない現実として、私がそれだけの出産に耐えられるかの不安はある。
Main.TextENG: ...However, there was the inescapable worry of whether I would be able to handle giving birth that many times.

Main.TextJPN: 「でも、そんなことを不安に思って出産を嫌う母なんて、いないですものねぇ…」
Main.TextENG: ``There isn't a mother out there who would hate to give birth because of that worry, though...``

Main.TextJPN: 雪絵はそう独り言を言って笑いながら、自分のお腹をやさしくさするのだった。
Main.TextENG: Yukie, smiling as she said that to herself, gently stroked her stomach.

Main.TextJPN: 警視庁公安部。
Main.TextENG: The Metropolitan Public Safety Division.

Main.TextJPN: あの人の正義心がたどり着いた先。
Main.TextENG: The place where that man's sense of justice had lead him.

Main.TextJPN: ……あの人は本当はとてもやさしくて、傷つきやすい人。
Main.TextENG: ...That person was actually a very gentle, very fragile person.

Main.TextJPN: あまり詳しくは聞かせてくれないけれど、…今の仕事はあまりあの人には向いていないと思っている。
Main.TextENG: He didn't talk much about the specifics, but I didn't think he was suited for the assignment he was on right now.

Main.TextJPN: でも、…あの人が頑張ると言い続けている内は、私も温かく見守るつもりだ。
Main.TextENG: But... as long as he said he was going to try his best, I would watch over him warmly.

Main.TextJPN: 「あなたのお父さんはね、…とっても頑張り屋さんなのよ？　こちょこちょこちょこちょ……☆」
Main.TextENG: ``Your father, you see... is a very hard worker, you know? Coochie coochie coo...☆.``

Main.TextJPN: 雪絵は自分のお腹に話しかけながら、とても楽しそうだった。
Main.TextENG: Yukie seemed to be enjoying herself as she talked to her own belly.

Main.TextJPN: …その時、雪絵はなぜかふと気になり、窓を見た。
Main.TextENG: ...At that moment, Yukie suddenly became concerned about something, and looked out the window.

Main.TextJPN: 刻限は夕方。
Main.TextENG: It used to be this time...

Main.TextJPN: ……昔。@k小さかった頃、祖母の田舎ではこんな時間には、ひぐらしの合唱でいっぱいに満たされていたのを思い出す。
Main.TextENG: Long ago.@k She remembered that when she was little, around this time in the countryside where her grandmother lived, the higurashi would fill the air with their chorus.

Main.TextJPN: ここは東京のど真ん中。
Main.TextENG: This was the middle of Tokyo.

Main.TextJPN: 田舎と違い、ひぐらしの合唱は聞くことができない。
Main.TextENG: Unlike in the countryside, you couldn't hear the song of the higurashi.

Main.TextJPN: ……なのになぜか、…その時の雪絵は、ひぐらしの声が聞きたい…と思った。
Main.TextENG: ...But for some reason... at that moment Yukie felt that she wanted to hear that song.
